name: Thymol
desc: Thymol is a phenolic compound present in many essential oils, known as 1-methyl-hydroxy-4-isopropylbenzene. In its natural form it is found mainly in thyme, but also in oregano, savory or Coptic cumin.
techs: Thymol has very strong antibacterial, antifungal and antibacterial properties. It occurs as a white, crystalline substance.
shelf: The shelf life of Thymol is 36 months. Product should be stored in a dry, cool place.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Thymol in 25kg bags.
applications: Thymol is a very valuable ingredient in many traditional and herb-based medicines. Due to its effective properties, such as effective expectorant, antitussive and antiseptic action, Thymol can be used against a wide range of diseases and ailments.
